item.title: Modern Warfare 3: How to Get Tactical Stance Kills
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Tactical Stance Mode Explained
  • How to Get Tac-Stance Kills
  • The Best Class Setup for Getting Tac-Stance Kills
  • The Best Modes for the Tactical Stance Challenge
  • Tips for Mastering Tac-Stance Assassinations

A challenge in Modern Warfare 3 requires players to get Tactical Stance kills. However, the task doesn’t come with instructions, which has baffled some players. They wonder what a Tac-Stance is and how it can be used to kill enemies. This quick MW3 guide clarifies everything about the challenge and offers tips for landing Tactical Stance kills with ease.

Updated on July 30, 2024, by Mohsen Baqery : With MW3 joining Xbox Game Pass, thousands of new players are expected to join Activision's multiplayer shooter. These newcomers might be curious about the tactical stance feature, a relatively new addition to the Modern Warfare franchise. To help new players learn more, this article has been updated with a detailed explanation of the feature, along with clear instructions for activating the tac-stance mode and achieving kills with it.

Tactical Stance Mode Explained

Also known as tac-stance, the tactical stance is a shooting mode in Modern Warfare 3 . When toggled on, the player holds the gun tilted to one side, firing without aiming down the sight. Similar to hip fire mode, shots in the tactical stance are less accurate compared to aiming down sights (ADS). However, this mode is advantageous in close-quarter battles (CQB), where quick reactions are more important than precision.

Platform

Tac-Stance Input

PC

Press V while you’re aiming down sight

PlayStation 4 and 5

Press down on the D-Pad while holding L2 (or the ADS button)

Xbox One and Xbox Series X/S

Press down on the D-Pad while holding LT (or the ADS button)

How to Get Tac-Stance Kills

Tactical kills are achieved by shooting down enemies in the side-grip mode . First, toggle on the Tac-Stance by pressing down on the D-pad while aiming. (It’s ADS + V on PC.) Next, assassinate enemies while the weapon is tipped on its side.

Introduced in Modern Warfare 3 , Tac-Stance is a canted firing technique . It allows the player to unshoulder the weapon, tilt it to the side, and shoot in a half-ADS half-hipfire state.

The Best Class Setup for Getting Tac-Stance Kills

Attachment-wise, any component that would increase accuracy and Tac Stance Spread is a must. Suppressors, short barrels, and visible lasers are excellent for maximum Tactical Stance kills.

For the equipment, Infantry is the ideal vest. Tracker gear like the Backlight Flashlight is handy. In addition to that, tactical items such as Stun Grenades are a must—as they facilitate hipfire kills by slowing down the enemy.

Since the Tac-Stance ditches ADS, leave the Optic’s slot empty. Give its spot to a stability-inducing attachment. An underbarrel, stock, or rear grip would be a better replacement.

The Best Modes for the Tactical Stance Challenge

Hardcore modes with dense maps are optimal for getting Tac-Stance kills. Enemies in these modes have fewer HPs and are easier to locate, making it feasible to land hipfire and no-crosshair shots. Free For All, Kill Confirm, and Domination are the best options.

As for the maps, Rust, Scrapyard, and Terminal offer the highest Tactical Stance kill ratio. These small areas enable Close Quarters Battle (CQB), which is crucial for the camo challenges.

Tips for Mastering Tac-Stance Assassinations

Below is a list of best practices for getting more Tactical Stance kills:

  • Turn the Center Dot on . Go to the Interface Settings and toggle the Center Dot on for your Crosshair. This will show a large dot in the middle of the screen replacing your ironsight in the tac-stance mode.
  • Reduce Tactical Stance Spread . When building your weapon, aim to pick attachments that minimize tac-stance spread. This will maximize your accuracy while shooting with your gun tilted to the side.
  • Hunt the enemy down . A “track & assassinate” strategy is ideal. Spot the enemy in advance and approach them poised to attack.
  • Exploit tactical equipment . Stun Grenades, Flash Bangs, and Dead Silence Field Upgrade can maximize Tac-Stance kills. (They neutralize the enemy and expose their position.)
  • Slow down before shooting . The tac-Stance cuts accuracy. Stabilize before engagement for less gunkick.

item.title: Traveller's Tales" LEGO Batman 3's DLC Model Shouldn't Have Faced the Reaper
item.description:
Highlights

  • LEGO games have seen a lot of character-based DLC packs, but they need to offer more than just expanding character rosters.
  • LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham set the standard with new levels alongside new characters in their DLC packs, making them worth it.
  • Future LEGO games like LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga need to make their post-launch content more substantial for fans.

Just like with almost every game these days, Traveller's Tales' LEGO franchise has seen a plethora of DLC packs over the years. Games like LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga , LEGO DC Super-Villains , and LEGO Jurassic World were all expanded upon considerably with character-based packs. But, while that has been fun to see, these DLCs could be so much more. Specifically, they need to resemble the days of LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham once more.

Although LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham was not the first LEGO game to get DLC, it was the first to take it beyond simply expanding the character roster. Alongside these new characters, the game also introduced brand-new levels for players to explore. They may not have been the most advanced of levels, but their inclusion made these DLCs feel far more worth it. So, if Traveller's Tales wants to continue down this post-launch content route, then it needs to really consider bringing those fun additions back.

LEGO Games Need to Make Their DLC Feel Important Again

LEGO Batman 3 Had the Perfect Approach to DLC

Released in 2014, LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham took the DC LEGO games to new heights by whisking players away on an intergalactic adventure. It may not have matched the quality of its predecessors, but that blend made for something that felt truly unique. Instead of leaving it behind for the next LEGO adventure, Traveller's Tales would end up expanding upon it with numerous DLC packs themed after current and past DC projects.

These DLC packs would expand LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham 's character roster with over 40 new characters. Additionally, some of these packs would include new levels to go alongside the new playable heroes. Players could fight their way through a climactic chase from The Dark Knight , they could experience Oliver Queen's desperate fight for survival in Arrow , and even explore new levels based around The Suicide Squad and Bizarro. All of these not only gave players more levels to conquer, but also served as a great way to introduce these brand-new characters.

This DLC model would continue in LEGO Marvel's Avengers , with levels based on various MCU films that were coming out around that time. Along with that, LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens , LEGO DC Super-Villains, and LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 would also receive level packs. But, outside of that, the majority of other LEGO games simply got character packs or no DLC at all.

Future LEGO Games Need to Offer More Substantial Post-Launch Content

LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga has gotten the most DLC packs so far, yet none of them include any levels. Additionally, many of the packs have garnered criticism from the fanbase as many of the characters are not even voiced or that unique enough to warrant a whole pack. While it may be fun for diehard fans to play with them, this approach to DLC leaves much to be desired.

However, it does not have to be this way. If Traveller's Tales continued to follow the model it started with LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham , then these DLC packs could feel worth it. Letting players play as characters from shows like The Bad Batch is fun, but if there was also a level highlighting a pivotal moment from that show, then the entire pack would be improved tenfold.

There is no news on when Traveller's Tales' next LEGO adventure will be released, nor has the topic been revealed yet. But, when it does finally release, it really needs to make that post-launch content feel worth it. And if the rumors of it being a Harry Potter game are true, then there is seemingly infinite potential for this type of content. So, hopefully, the studio ends up delivering.

item.title: Pokemon: Best Ways To Shiny Hunt Fossil Pokemon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Shiny hunters can unite for the Fossil Week event, focusing on hunting fossil Pokemon in various games this summer.
  • Different methods like wild encounters, space-time distortions, mass outbreaks, and revive resets can aid in shiny hunting.
  • The Masuda Method is a guaranteed option for shiny hunting fossil Pokemon, accessible for players in various games.

With shiny hunting and shiny hunters making up a sizeable portion of the Pokemon fanbase, several content creators in the fandom often host themed shiny hunting events as a way to interact and somewhat unify the community every so often. This summer, running from August 2nd to the 11th, the Fossil Week event, hosted by content creators Tales of Taylor and Kwikpanik, focuses entirely on hunting one of the smallest Pokemon groups - fossil Pokemon.

Since fossil Pokemon have been around since Red and Blue and feature in Scarlet and Violet , there are plenty of ways to go about hunting these prehistoric monsters. And unlike the similar past paradox Pokemon, there are far more options than roaming around the overworld. From the most involved to the simplest, the options for shiny hunting any kind of fossil Pokemon are obvious.

1 Wild Encounters

Back From Extinction

While fossil Pokemon rarely appear in the wild, given their whole gimmick and theme, it is entirely possible to shiny hunt almost all fossil Pokemon in the overworld. In both Sword and Shield 's Crown Tundra and Scarlet and Violet 's Blueberry Terrarium, players can find fossil Pokemon roaming around freely.

Although the Galar mismatched fossils aren't included in this, players are able to find practically every fossil walking around the overworld between the four games. Sword and Shield 's chaining system and Scarlet and Violet 's sandwiches may speed up the process of finding an off-colored, formerly extinct Pokemon, but isn't even close to being an efficient process.

2 Space-Time Distortion

Fighting Against Time

One of the main mechanics of Legends: Arceus' maps, the occasional space-time distortions offer players chances to catch Pokemon completely out of time, including Sinnoh's two fossil lines. Certainly one of the most involved processes for shiny hunting given the inherent timer associated with the space-time distortions, and the often limited return for these events, the notable benefit to shiny hunting with these distortions is the chance for a shiny Alpha, or ShAlpha, fossil.

While the Alpha trait is hard enough to guarantee a shiny through the distortions, the chance of having a gigantic, red-eyed, and red-crowned Rampardos in a shiny collection is a hard offer to pass up. The chance at a ShAlpha fossil, whether Shieldon or Cranidos, is too good for shiny hunters to ignore.

3 Mass Outbreaks

Limited Choices For Boosted Odds

With only two fossil Pokemon in Scarlet and Violet , and with the usual option for reviving these prehistoric Pokemon not existing, the option for Cranidos and Shieldon to appear in mass outbreaks is a wonderful bonus compared to previous entries. Featuring effectively infinite chances at finding a shiny Pokemon, and with the ability to combine with the shiny-boosting powers of sandwiches, outbreaks are easily one of the fastest options for finding shiny fossils.

Since only two fossils can be found this way, it isn't quite as useful for players wanting to hunt something beyond the Sinnoh fossils. For players that want Shieldon and Cranidos or otherwise don't care, this is potentially the best method once the appropriate outbreak has been found.

4 Revive Resets

The Classic Option

Depending on the game and the hardware used, reviving fossils at a given location and soft resetting when a shiny doesn't appear is probably the fastest possible way to find a shiny fossil of any kind. For players with access to a 3DS, cycling through hundreds of revived Pokemon is a breeze, no matter what game they use, so long as they have enough fossils for their given hunt. For players on the Switch, the Sinnoh Grand Underground is just the place to search.

While certain games work best when resetting with five fossils and games such as XY and Let's Go work wonderfully with as many fossils as possible, all players have to do is find enough of their chosen Pokemon's fossil item and save right before reviving. After that, it's often a mindless and exceedingly simple process of checking either the team summary or PC for the rare find. Since this is the intended way of obtaining fossil Pokemon in general, shiny or otherwise, it is usually the go-to for shiny hunting the fossils, as it fits the theme perfectly and appeals to the general aesthetic of these extinct Pokemon.

5 Masuda Method

The Guaranteed Option

Often the defacto option for shiny hunting given the ease, guaranteed capture, and increased odds, the Masuda method is still one of the best options for trying to find a shiny fossil Pokemon. Possible with every single fossil Pokemon except Dracovish, Arctovish, Dracozolt, and Arctozolt, it's also one of the most convenient choices as well.

Since this works across practically every Pokemon game, especially games post generation five for increased shiny odds and most notably in Sword and Shield , and it only requires the revived fossil Pokemon and a Ditto, it's very accessible for even the newest player. While not exactly as engaging as other choices, it is a tried and true method, and now that fossils can be in other Poke Balls beyond the classic, it's even better.

item.title: The 16 Best EA Games, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • EA has worked hard to improve its image by focusing on single-player games and reworking microtransactions.
  • Best EA games span various genres and offer immersive experiences loved by fans.
  • Titles like Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order and FIFA 15 showcase EA's ability to deliver quality games.

There are many people around who are very eager to label EA as one of the worst gaming companies of all time, but the truth is that this organization has tried its hardest to turn its image around after becoming the punching bag of the gaming industry. Their renewed focus on single-player games while trying to rework how they integrate microtransactions has done a great job of letting players appreciate them instead of calling them out time and time again.

There are many great games with EA's label on them that have become some of the best video game experiences that fans can expose themselves to. The best EA games encompass a wide range of genres and will be quite appealing to gamers with varying and selective tastes.

Updated on July 30, 2024 by Ritwik Mitra: Electronic Arts is a company that gamers know all about. This AAA publisher owns some of the most profitable sports video game franchises of all time and houses certain studios that have made huge waves in the gaming landscape. While not all of their games have been absolute hits and the company is known for pursuing profits instead of making creative games, that's not to say that games with the Electronic Arts label are completely devoid of quality. Some of the best EA games are beloved by the masses and should be played by fans of the respective genres. These good-quality video games will capture their attention for hours with no problem.

16 Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order

Metascore: 79

Fallen Order 's launch was rough, with a wealth of bugs marring what should've been a fun experience. Thankfully, Respawn wasted no time in ironing out the kinks, letting players enjoy an incredible video game that is arguably one of the finest single-player Star Wars games around.

Cal Kestis is a compelling protagonist who ends up playing a major role without being too grating in the process. Jedi: Survivor continues the story of this hero, and it's a shame that the launch of this title somehow managed to be even more broken than its predecessor.

15 FIFA 15

Metascore: 82

Most people would just dismiss the FIFA series and comment on the fact that every title is pretty much interchangeable when it comes to the gameplay. While this is true to an extent, there's no denying that the polished gameplay of this annual sports video game series makes the act of controlling one's favorite soccer team to score goals a highly engaging one.

FIFA 12 and 15 are considered by many to be two of the best games in the long-running series, with the latter edging out the former because of how fun its gameplay felt. Later titles have tried to make some changes to the gameplay with varying degrees of success, but FIFA 15 continues to stand strong as one of the greatest sports games that deserves all the time in the spotlight, and then some.

14 Dragon Age: Inquisition

Metascore: 85

Despite the many problems that plagued Dragon Age: Inquisition during its development, most people agreed that it was a solid addition to the franchise and a step in the right direction after Dragon Age 2 attempted to make the franchise appeal to a broader market. Forming an Inquisition and saving the world from Corypheus' malevolence is a blast, especially with the many things players can do along the way.

The idea of separating the story into DLCs was maligned by many, but Inquisition has slowly garnered a positive reputation over time. It's easy to see why players are hotly anticipating the release of Dragon Age: The Veilguard , even if the reveal of this game worried many. Fans will be replaying this game right now to keep their memory fresh when it comes to the series' impressive lore.

13 Dragon Age: Origins

Metascore: 86

The acquisition of BioWare by EA allowed the studio to flex a big budget in their game like never before. After being hailed as the king of the CRPG genre, the company moved to a more mainstream action-focused title with the advent of Dragon Age: Origins .

The experiment was a massive success, with the varying origins of the player character, a rich fantasy world, and some great storytelling turning Dragon Age: Origins into one of the most beloved Western RPGs of all time. To this day, fans still consider this game to be the best title in the series, and understandably so.

12 The Sims 3

Metascore: 86

Most people consider The Sims 3 to be the best game in this popular life simulation series, with the inclusion of a seamless open world and new mechanics being seen as groundbreaking by many. While this game could be rather demanding for PCs at the time, it didn't take long before post-launch support for this game stabilized the experience.

This, coupled with the wealth of new content that was added, made The Sims 3 one of the best video games ever made. The reason why so many people continue to be disappointed by The Sims 4 is because it was a step down from its predecessor in many ways, and fans can only hope that The Sims 5 doesn't repeat the same mistakes.

11 It Takes Two

Metascore: 88

After working on A Way Out , Josef Fares went all out in the development of a co-op story-driven game that ended up being one of the best titles that fans can get their hands on. It Takes Two focuses on the story of Cody and May, two people in a strained marriage and on the verge of getting a divorce when their child, Rose, wishes for a way to make them see past their differences.

This turns them into two dolls who have to go through a wide range of challenges that switch up the gameplay in fresh and engaging ways. It Takes Two was lauded for its incredible gameplay, even if the narrative was a bit too cliched and uninteresting for most people, who considered it to be the weakest part of the experience.

10 Burnout Paradise

Metascore: 88

It's a shame that no new title in the Burnout series has arrived after all this time, with a remaster of Burnout Paradise being the only thing that fans have enjoyed recently. It's a shame that this franchise has remained dormant for so long, but the fact that fans were reminded of the excellence present in Burnout Paradise was a nice treat nevertheless.

The game is arcade racing at its best, allowing players to take out other races in the most ostentatious manner possible. It's impossible to start up a session and get bored of Burnout Paradise because of the sheer carnage that can arise from its scintillating racing gameplay.

9 Dead Space

Metascore: 89

The fact that one of the greatest survival horror games ever made was greenlit by EA is a testament to the studio's penchant to put their eggs in riskier baskets from time to time. Visceral Games developed one of the most atmospheric and entertaining horror titles, with Dead Space 's claustrophobic atmosphere and immersive design making it one of the best EA games in the eyes of many.

Isaac Clarke's grisly adventures aboard the USG Ishimura make for a captivating time, with players having to deal with necromorphs and other grisly enemies in a game packed with gore and disturbing moments. A huge part of the storyline involves Isaac's hunt for her girlfriend only to find out that the Marker was causing him to hallucinate whenever he thought he was speaking to Nicole.

8 Apex Legends

Metascore: 89

Live-service games have attained somewhat of a poor reputation in the industry, with many players feeling like these games are nothing more than elaborate schemes to eat through as much of a player's funds as possible. Regardless of how true this statement may be, there's no denying that some live-service titles have extremely fun gameplay loops, with Apex Legends being a great example of the same.

The movement mechanics in this game are truly impressive and are the best part of the experience by a country mile. While there are some pay-to-win mechanics in Apex Legends , they aren't anywhere near as egregious as most people would expect from a free-to-play title.

7 Titanfall 2

Metascore: 89

Titanfall 2 is one of the most underrated sequels in gaming history. Not only did it address all the problems of the first game and improve the groundbreaking traversal system, but it also features a single-player campaign that is entertaining and emotional at the same time.

It's saddening that this game didn't match EA's sales expectations, which led to the cancellation of Titanfall 3 with EA putting all their resources into developing Apex Legends instead. This bargain may have worked for EA, but it came at the cost of a sequel that had the potential to be one of the greatest FPS games ever made if its predecessor was anything to go by.

6 Dead Space 2

Metascore: 90

The first game in the Dead Space series made for a great immersive time as players took on the role of Isaac Clarke and explored the desolate halls of the USG Ishimura. When Dead Space 2 rolled out, fans were pleasantly surprised to see how far things were pushed in this amazing game.

There was a greater focus on action over horror, but that did nothing to take away from Dead Space 's amazing atmosphere in the slightest. The game had the power to terrify the player in each combat encounter, and it helped that everything from the story to the presentation was a step up from the first game.

5 The Sims 2

Metascore: 90

There's no denying that Maxis had settled on a winning formula with the advent of The Sims . However, the game was still rough around the edges and needed some polishing before this life sim could become even more popular. With their publisher's guidance, the sequel to this title ended up being one of the best EA games around that fans still look back on fondly to this day.

The Sims 2 single-handedly established many iconic aspects of the series and let players enjoy a video game with incredible freedom and intricate mechanics. With numerous expansion packs ensuring that this game remained relevant for years, it's easy to see why The Sims 2 attracted so many fans to the series and turned the franchise into a household name.

4 Crysis

Metascore: 91

Crysis blew everyone's minds when it launched, with the graphics of this title being so advanced that even high-end rigs at the time had a problem running this game. The revolutionary CryEngine was a huge reason why this game was so ahead of its time, ensuring that players would remember this title as one of the best EA games ever made.

Controlling Nomad and using his nanosuit to take out hostile soldiers makes for a great time, with players accessing their power fantasies as they become invisible and use the enhanced power of their nanosuit to grab hapless soldiers and fling them around like ragdolls. Players who managed to run Crysis at the time were more than impressed by its immense graphics that look even better in the Remastered edition of this title.

3 Mass Effect

Metascore: 91

When Mass Effect came out, many people were glad to see BioWare make a return to the sci-fi genre with an epic tale that players absolutely loved. The first game may have some gameplay quirks that are hard to ignore now, but the Legendary Edition takes care of this gripe and lets players have way more fun with the gameplay of the first Mass Effect .

Commander Shepard's companions are quite interesting, and the player character themself can form a personality of their own, even if it may be a bit too binary for most people's tastes. Still, the slow burn of this narrative sets the stage for an epic tale that spans two more games and is an incredible ride in every way.

2 Mass Effect 3

Metascore: 93

Mass Effect 2 was a phenomenon that set the expectations of the next game sky-high. The improved gameplay and new stakes for the story were as captivating as can be, so fans were more than disappointed to see the vast majority of their choices have little to no impact on the game's ending.

For what it's worth, the additional content gave some closure with certain beloved characters and expanded on the endings to make things more satisfying. Most people agree that Mass Effect 3 is one of the greatest games ever made until its ending, which is the best statement to personify what the discourse around this title boils down to.

1 Mass Effect 2

Metascore: 96

The first Mass Effect title was a valiant foray into the sci-fi genre by BioWare, with the result being appreciated by many despite the combat feeling rather static at times. Well, not only does the sequel improve upon the first game's gameplay in every way, but it also enhances the quality of the storytelling significantly.

To this day, the narrative and characters of Mass Effect 2 continue to hold a special place in the hearts of fans. The suicide mission is easily one of the best ending sequences in any video game ever. This is precisely what makes the conclusion of the final title in the trilogy such a disappointing one.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.05 Update Brings Job Changes and New Treasure Dungeon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.05 adds a new Treasure Dungeon and Dawntrail's first set of Savage raids.
  • Several Job adjustments have also been implemented, with Samurai, Viper, and Black Mage seeing the most changes.
  • Square Enix will showcase Final Fantasy 14 at Gamescom in August, revealing more details about upcoming patches.

To close out a busy July, Final Fantasy 14 has launched Patch 7.05, bringing with it a new treasure dungeon, the first Savage tier of The Arcadion raid series, and several Job changes across the board. The latest Final Fantasy 14 update went live following a brief, overnight maintenance period.

The new Final Fantasy 14 update arrives shortly after the launch of The Arcadion raid series in Patch 7.01, introducing the AAC Light-Heavyweight Tier for level 100 players to test their skills. Players who complete the raids once per week will earn tokens that can be exchanged for corresponding armor pieces and accessories based on a player's chosen Job and role. The 7.01 update also implemented changes to a handful of Jobs, with Monk in particular receiving the most attention from the developers. In response to player feedback, the Monk's Beast Chakra gauge was updated, and several core skills were adjusted to reflect this change.

Two weeks after the release of Patch 7.01, Square Enix has released another content update for players to enjoy. According to a Lodestone post, Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.05 brings a new Treasure Dungeon called Cenote Ja Ja Gural, located in the ruins of the Yak T'el region. Similar to Endwalker 's Excite-A-Tron 6000 map dungeon, Cenote Ja Ja Gural is best done with a full party of eight players and requires Timeworn Br'aaxskin Maps to access. Patch 7.05 also brought the AAC Light-Heavyweight Tier (Savage) raid series, which includes four grueling boss fights. The new Savage raid tier is the first in over a year, following the Pandaemonium: Anabaseios (Savage) series released during Endwalker 's Patch 6.4.

As for Job changes, Final Fantasy 14 's 7.05 update buffs many Jobs across the board. Several Jobs, including Paladin, Machinist, Ninja, and Dark Knight saw some adjustments to their main skills to bring them in line with other Jobs in their respective roles. The Samurai saw a major change to Tsubame-gaeshi, which will see it used more often. However, the change resulted in some nerfs to other Samurai skills. In a continuation of its 7.01 changes, Black Mage saw further adjustments to Umbral Soul and spells such as Fire IV, Paradox, and Flare. The Viper saw more changes this time around, as its Noxious Gnash debuff was removed and several skills were adjusted to compensate.

Between the new 7.05 update and an upcoming appearance at Gamescom, Final Fantasy 14 's summer schedule remains a busy one. With future Dawntrail patches still to come, it remains to be seen how Jobs will continue changing to keep up with player feedback.

Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.05 Notes (July 30, 2024)

Resolved Issues

  • The following issues have been addressed.
    • An issue when undertaking the main quest "In His Garden" wherein graphics for female Hrothgar characters did not display correctly during a specific cutscene.
    • An issue with duty roulette wherein the bonus to experience points granted for undertaking level 90 trials was incorrect.
    • An issue in the level 100 trial added in Patch 7.0 wherein players were incapacitated when executing Virtual Shift under certain conditions.
    • An issue wherein the striking dummy in Stone, Sky, Sea had incorrect HP values when undertaken as viper or pictomancer for duties prior to Patch 7.0.
    • An issue in the trial Alexander - The Soul of the Creator wherein the sound for Temporal Stasis did not play correctly.
    • An issue wherein other players appeared invisible after exiting a deep dungeon under certain conditions.
    • An issue when playing as gunbreaker wherein players were able to execute Fated Brand despite not having acquired Continuation.
    • An issue wherein the description for the samurai PvE action Tengentsu failed to note the damage reduction afforded by Tengentsu's Foresight. * This was a text-only issue. The action itself remains unchanged.
    • An issue when playing as summoner wherein the PvE action Lux Solaris erroneously canceled combos.
    • An issue when playing as pictomancer wherein switching the Palette Gauge to Simple Mode caused the icon and numerical display to appear excessively close.
    • An issue when playing as white mage wherein the status Divine Caress would be replaced with Divine Aura when changing jobs and under other conditions.
    • An issue with the scholar PvE action Recitation wherein reference to Concitation was missing from the status description. * This was a text-only issue. The action itself remains unchanged.
    • An issue wherein the sage PvE action Eukrasian Dyskrasia erroneously stated the cure potency of Kardion before acquiring Enhanced Healing Magic. * This was a text-only issue. The action itself remains unchanged.
    • An issue when executing specific PvE actions targeting multiple enemies wherein statuses and resource changes were not applied under certain conditions.
    • An issue wherein the value of the block strength and block rate attributes of shields with an equipment level of 91 and above were incorrect.
    • An issue wherein housing lighting settings were not functioning correctly.
    • An issue wherein shadows and lighting inside housing were not functioning correctly.
    • An issue wherein dyes were not applied to the correct portions of the Horos Bottoms.
    • An issue wherein dyes were not applied to the correct portions of the Mandervillous Gunblade and the Mandervillous Gunblade Replica.
    • An issue when wearing the Vanguard Helm of Fending or Vanguard Helm of Maiming while playing as a female Miqo'te wherein the ears were not displayed correctly.
    • An issue when wearing the Pictomancer's Turban while playing as a Miqo'te wherein equipped earrings were displayed despite ears being hidden by the headgear.
    • An issue wherein the graphics for certain gear was displaying incorrectly.
    • An issue wherein the graphics of the housing exteriors Microscopically Small Mogwalls, Middlingly Medium Mogwalls, and Monstrously Large Mogwalls did not display correctly.
    • An issue wherein dyes were not applied to the correct portions of the Bomb Cauldron.
    • An issue wherein dyes were not applied to the correct portions of the Twintop Table.
    • An issue wherein the graphics for the furnishing Glade Fringed Rug did not display correctly under certain conditions.
    • An issue wherein the graphics for the furnishing Portable Pool did not display correctly.
    • An issue wherein the graphics for the furnishing Lakeland Flower Garden did not display correctly.
    • An issue wherein an incongruous shadow was displayed for a specific hairstyle.
    • An issue wherein the graphics for a portion of certain hairstyles did not display correctly.
    • An issue wherein the effect of the item Superior Spiritbond Potion had been reduced beyond the level set at the release of Patch 6.58.
    • An issue wherein the amount of purple crafters' scrips required to exchange for certain Skysteel tool materials was incorrect.
    • An issue with the fishing log wherein unexplored sections of the map would be erroneously displayed.
    • An issue wherein mount animations would not display correctly when turning during flight.
    • An issue wherein background graphics in the Goblet did not display correctly.
    • An issue wherein graphics for the waterway in Mist did not display correctly.
    • An issue wherein the graphics for the NPC Kajeel Ja did not display correctly.
    • An issue wherein the FATE progress indicator did not accurately reflect the player's current progress under certain conditions.
    • An issue wherein the fade-out timing was incorrect for an orchestrion roll added in Patch 7.01 when playing it in a playlist.
    • An issue when adding a party or alliance member to the blacklist or mute list wherein sound notifications would play for the corresponding character.
    • An issue wherein non-blacklisted characters would appear as "Unknown" under certain conditions.
    • An issue wherein characters waiting for approval of a friend request, or characters with a friend request pending could be muted.
    • An issue wherein text commands shown at the bottom of the alarm editor window were incorrectly displayed.
    • An issue wherein UI windows did not display correctly. (Xbox Series X|S)
    • Other minor text issues have also been addressed.

  • Other various issues have also been addressed.

Known Issues

  • An issue when undertaking the healer role quest "Taste of a Toxin Paradise" wherein using Esuna on the NPC Laugh-weary Lalafell before the NPC Befuddled Bather prevents the subsequent cutscene from triggering, thereby preventing players from progressing through the quest. * In the event you encounter this issue, please log out of the game and log back in, and ensure you use Esuna on the NPC Befuddled Bather before using it on the NPC Laugh-weary Lalafell.
  • An issue with AAC Light-heavyweight M1 and AAC Light-heavyweight M1 (Savage) wherein, under certain conditions, players do not immediately fall when the portion of floor beneath them was destroyed. * This issue was discovered shortly before the release of the patch. We are currently examining whether a server-side solution is feasible, and plan to implement a fix as quickly as possible. We apologize for any inconvenience caused, and ask that players refrain from strategically exploiting this issue while we work to resolve it.
  • An issue wherein Quetzalli Bracelets of Casting erroneously appear as Quetzalli Bracelets of Healing. * Due to this issue, two items are listed as Augmented Quetzalli Bracelets of Healing when speaking with Theone in Solution Nine (X:8.5 Y:13.6). Please note that the first of the two items are Augmented Quetzalli Bracelets of Casting, and the required jobs are listed correctly when viewing their item descriptions.
